sn35.186:3.1: 186 The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past
sn35.186:4.1: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind were impermanent.
sn35.186:4.4: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.186:4.9: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.186:4.10: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
